"""
    Ensures that expected exceptions occur when running simulate() with invalid
    parameters.
    """
test_mlmc = MLMCSimulator(models=models_from_data, data=data_input)
with pytest.raises(ValueError):
    test_mlmc.simulate(epsilon=-0.1, initial_sample_sizes=20)
with pytest.raises(TypeError):
    test_mlmc.simulate(epsilon='one', initial_sample_sizes=20)
with pytest.raises(TypeError):
    test_mlmc.simulate(epsilon=0.1, initial_sample_sizes='five')
with pytest.raises(TypeError):
    test_mlmc.simulate(epsilon=0.1, initial_sample_sizes=5, target_cost='3')
with pytest.raises(ValueError):
    test_mlmc.simulate(epsilon=0.1, initial_sample_sizes=5, target_cost=-1)
with pytest.raises(ValueError):
    test_mlmc.simulate(epsilon=0.1, initial_sample_sizes=1)
with pytest.raises(ValueError):
    test_mlmc.simulate(epsilon=0.1, initial_sample_sizes=[5, 4, 3, 2])
